node.title: 'It was terrifying': Two days after her operation, Sam was on her way back to hospital, screaming in extreme pain
node.alt: A woman with short hair looks into the camera with a serious expression.
node.description: Canberra gynaecologist Omar Adham has been cautioned by the medical regulator about obtaining informed consent from a patient before an operation, as it investigates complaints from seven of Dr Adham's former patients.
node.content:
["Sam Cook-Bateman had already had nine\u00a0keyhole surgeries to treat her endometriosis \u2014 three of those with the Canberra Endometriosis Centre's lead gynaecologist, Omar Adham.", "The operations with Dr Adham had gone well.", "\"He removed lesions, and I felt better afterwards,\" she says.", "But in 2015, two days after a fourth operation with Dr Adham at private hospital Calvary John James, she suddenly experienced intense abdominal pain.", "\"My husband knew that something was wrong. So, he immediately rang Dr\u00a0Adham's rooms.", "\"And his response was to my husband 'put her in the car and drive her straight to Canberra hospital'.", "\"He asked if he should call an ambulance, his response was, 'we don't have time'.", "\"It was terrifying \u2026 I remember being in the back of the car, lying down screaming in extreme pain,\" she says.", "Mrs\u00a0Cook-Bateman was rushed in for an emergency operation.", "Surgeons found an \"extensive thermal injury to (her) rectum\".", "They said it was consistent with her surgery a few days before.", "A \"perforation\" meant faeces were \"draining into [her] abdomen\".", "Mrs Cook-Bateman had part of her bowel removed and a colostomy bag attached for eight months.", "", "
Mrs Cook-Bateman wore a colostomy bag for eight months after having part of her bowel removed.(Supplied)
", "Mrs Cook-Bateman's complaint is one of eight from former patients of Dr Adham currently before the medical regulator, the Australian Health Practitioner Regulation Agency (AHPRA), seven of which are being investigated.", "Dr Adham was cautioned last year after he asked a patient to consent to an additional procedure while she was lying on a gurney about to have exploratory keyhole surgery.", "While one of the current investigations also involves the issue of informed consent, the majority relate to complications following keyhole surgery.", "Earlier this year, Dr Adham volunteered to have a senior colleague present during all keyhole surgery at the Canberra Hospital.", "Dr Adham told the ABC that's to show that he \"has nothing to hide in respect of his clinical competence\".", "", "
Omar Adham is the Canberra Endometriosis Centre's lead gynaecologist.(Canberra CityNews)
", "The Queanbeyan Public Hospital said Dr Adham had stopped working there following notification of an AHPRA/Medical Board investigation and a review of internal complaints.", "Dr Adham's solicitor told the ABC last month that Dr Adham's visiting privileges with Queanbeyan Hospital had not been terminated, but only suspended and were \"subject to reinstatement following a positive outcome of the hospital's review process\".", "A number of women contacted the ABC following a 7.30 story in July about former patients of Dr Adham's who said they had suffered complications after their surgery with Dr Adham and repair operations with other doctors.", "
'I've had no explanation'
", "Dr Adham visited Mrs Cook-Bateman in hospital and saw her again in his office weeks after the operation.", "\"I asked him what he thought went wrong because to that point, I'd had no explanation.", "\"His response was, 'I don't really know. I cauterised a bleed, like I've done 1,000 times.' That was the explanation I got,\" she says.", "", "
Mrs Cook-Bateman takes a number of medications, including for anxiety and depression.(ABC News: Greg Nelson)
", "Since the initial emergency surgery, she has had two more bowel operations with another surgeon. She still experiences bowel pain.", "\"It's difficult for me to process fibre, which is in pretty much everything.", "\"I'm on eight, nine different medications for various things, including anxiety and depression,\" she says", "Another woman, Kristy Stanford, interviewed by 730 in July, suffered a bowel complication following a keyhole procedure with Dr Adham three months before Mrs Cook-Bateman", "She had part of her bowel removed and a colostomy bag attached for months.", "", "
Kristy Stanford had part of her bowel removed following complications from keyhole surgery.(ABC News: David Maguire)
", "The Royal Women's Hospital says the average risk of bowel damage\u00a0in this kind of procedure\u00a0is 1 in 3,000, although it can be much higher \u2014 as great as one in 20 for serious complications with very invasive endometriosis.", "Ms Stanford said when she and her husband met with Dr Adham, he did not offer a clear explanation of what had gone wrong.", "\"During that meeting, all we wanted was an apology and he wouldn't do it. He would not do it. He was adamant that it could have happened to anyone,\" she said.", "She says she continues to suffer physically and psychologically.", "The ABC asked Dr Adham about the two cases, but he said he would not comment for ethical reasons.", "\"The claims against me are yet to be tested,\" he said in a statement.", "", "
Dr Adham said it would not be appropriate for him to comment on his patients.(Calvary Health Care)
", "\"There are properly established processes in place for the resolution of such claims, whether before a court of law or the health regulator.", "\"It is important not to pre-empt those processes. For that reason, I consider it would be inappropriate for me to respond to the ABC's questions \u2014 rather, the claims should be determined in the proper forum, once all facts are known, instead of prematurely becoming the subject of speculation by the public, based upon only one side of the story.", "\"I will await the outcome of any findings by the judiciary or health regulator, which I am confident will find no wrongdoing on my part.\"", "
Questions about consent for extra procedure
", "Juanita Connors is another patient who sought help from Dr Adham in 2018.", "She had\u00a0suffered from severe pelvic pain most of her adult life and was diagnosed with probable endometriosis 14 years earlier.", "Dr Adham said he would do a laparoscopy to investigate.", "On the day of the surgery, as the mother of four was lying on the gurney in preparation for her exploratory surgery, Dr Adham said he wanted to add an extra procedure.", "The procedure was an ablation \u2014 or burning \u2014 of nerves or ligaments near the spine to disrupt pain signals.", "", "
Juanita Connors sought Dr Adham's help with pelvic pain in 2018.(ABC News: David Maguire)
", "\u00a0\"I just remember him saying ,'it's gold.' My life was going to be improved after this surgery.", "\"He just passed me some papers saying you need to sign here and sign here,\" she says.", "Dr Adham later told the Clinical Director of Obstetrics and Gynaecology at ACT Health\u00a0that he advised Juanita the operation might or might not help her pelvic pain.", "In a letter, Dr Adham said the procedure he had offered Ms Connors was a \"minor add-on optional treatment\" and she had \"consented and did not raise concerns\".", "He also said the procedure was \"generally part of the endometriosis treatment\", although\u00a0Canberra Health later described it as a \"rare\" procedure which had been performed on one other patient that year \u2014 also a patient of Dr Adham's.", "Juanita says she continues to suffer terrible pain although no one has linked it to the operation.", "\"It's just a constant ache or pain in the bottom of my back.", "\"Sometimes I get Matt to rub my back where he can't even touch it because [the pain] would come from all around my hips will be all swirling, but the pain would be from the middle of my back.", "Juanita complained to Canberra Health Services that the procedure hadn't been explained properly. Six\u00a0months later, she received an apology from the CEO.", "Juanita was dissatisfied with that response and took it further, writing to the complaints body, the ACT Health Services Commission.", "The Health Services Commission got an independent expert, who told them studies showed there were doubts about whether the procedure done on Juanita was effective.", "One major study had shown it had \"no value\" for patients having endometriosis surgery.", "But given Juanita's significant pelvic pain, the expert thought it was reasonable to do the procedure.", "Critically, he said he thought Juanita had been \"appropriately consented\".", "", "
Juanita Connors with her partner Matt Jenkins and their children.(ABC News: David Maguire)
", "Juanita Connors's partner Matt Jenkins, who has been supporting her throughout, disagreed with that statement.", "\u00a0\"It was not even spoken about until she was getting wheeled into surgery.\u00a0", "\"We don't think we would have chosen that surgery if we had any time to research it,\" he said.", "In November last year, the Medical Board contradicted the expert opinion given to Health Services Commission in relation to consent.", "While the Board said there was \"insufficient information to determine that Ms Connors's ongoing pain was caused by this procedure\", it issued Dr Adham with a caution over the consent process.", "It found his \"performance [regarding consent] was below the standard reasonably expected of a registered medical practitioner\".", "The caution would \"mitigate(s) any future risk to patients\".", "But in keeping with its usual practice, that caution was not made public on AHPRA's website", "Lawyer Tom Ballantyne, the head of Maurice Blackburn's Victorian medical litigation\u00a0department, believes that's wrong.", "", "
Lawyer Tom Ballantyne says the medical regulator should make more information public on its website.(ABC News: Dan Harrison)
", "\"Certainly, I think there's scope to include more information on the register,\" he says.", "\"There are some actions taken that aren't on the register at all. So, a lot of patients are actually operating in a vacuum when it comes to understanding and being able to research their doctor's history and performance and track record.\"", "After years of suffering, and more procedures, Juanita is still seeking answers from specialists trying to find out the source of her pain.", "\"It's like fighting a losing battle. Just trying to get a diagnosis, what's wrong?", "\"I am now on antidepressants. And that's\u00a0also to help with the nerves. But honestly, I think if I wasn't strong enough, and I didn't have my kids, I wouldn't be here,\" Juanita says.", "The issue of consent was raised in 730's previous story by another of Dr Adham's patients, Julie Ashcroft.", "She had complications after a laparoscopy where surgical mesh was used.", "", "
Julie Ashcroft experienced complications after surgical mesh was used in her procedure.(ABC News: David Maguire)
", "Dr Adham had given her a brochure explaining that up to 10 per cent of women have complications with mesh, which could include erosion into nearby organs requiring it to be removed.", "However, Julie says she didn't realise mesh was going to be used, and there was no mention of mesh on the consent form she signed.", "The seven current complaints being investigated by AHPRA span procedures undertaken between 2013 and 2019.", "The ABC is aware of an earlier complaint that AHPRA was informed about in 2010.", "
Parents 'prepped' for a caesar, then the plan changed
", "Another complaint about Dr Adham was made by another woman but this time in relation to obstetrics.", "Kasey Tomkins says she was left confused about what had happened after her baby son Billy suffered injuries to his head and face due to instruments used during a traumatic birth.", "", "
Kasey Tomkins was expecting her\u00a0son Billy to be born via caesarean section.(Supplied)
", "Ms Tomkins had hoped to have a normal birth in September 2019 but during labour, it was discovered that she had a strange-shaped cervix and the baby was positioned poorly.", "When her labour stalled, the staff obstetrician at Canberra Hospital advised her to have a caesarean section. Ms Tomkins signed a consent form for the operation.", "\"We'd gotten our head around the fact that it wasn't going to be the traditional birth that we were expecting. We were both prepped,\" Ms Tomkins said.", "When Ms Tomkins was wheeled into the operating theatre at midnight, Dr\u00a0Adham, who was a visiting consultant at the hospital, was there.", "To her surprise, she was asked to try to deliver the baby naturally because she was fully dilated.", "\"I remember being a little bit surprised because it had been explained to us that we were going in there for a caesarean,\" Kasey's partner Nic Eccles said.", "", "
Kasey Tomkins and\u00a0Nic Eccles at home with their son, Billy.(ABC News: Greg Nelson)
", "Dr Adham then attempted to get the baby out using a vacuum, or kiwi cup, and forceps.\u00a0", "The couple say they don't have any recollection of being asked to consent to instruments.", "Ms Tomkins\u00a0had had an epidural, meaning she couldn't feel anything. A C-section drape was blocking the couple's view and made it difficult for them to register everything that was being said.", "\"I don't have a memory of him using the words,\u00a0'Kasey, we're going to try forceps', or, 'Kasey, we're going to try the kiwi cup,\"\u00a0she says.", "A statement from the Royal Australian and New Zealand College of Obstetricians and Gynaecologists says there must be \"clear communication\" to use instruments and \"written consent should generally be obtained in an operating theatre\".", "There was no signed consent for instruments on Kasey's medical records and the midwife's notes say there was a \"decision for assisted birth\" but don't mention consent.", "Dr Adham's handwritten operation notes say there was \"consent to instruments\" and \"consent [to have] \u2026\u00a0forceps applied\".", "\"When I read those notes, I genuinely was shocked,\" Ms Tomkins said.", "When the instruments failed, Dr Adham reverted to a caesar.", "A social worker later recorded Kasey as having gaps in her memory, but the couple say it was only after the birth that they realised instruments had been used.", "\"Billy's injuries were a cut over the top of his lip, and up to his nose, and scattered cuts and dents over his skull, and a large dent on his forehead,\" Nic says.", "Those injuries can occur with instrumental deliveries. But Billy also had a rare subgaleal haematoma on the back of his head. Hospital records say this was caused by \"multiple trials of instrumental delivery\".", "", "
Billy was placed in intensive care as a precaution.(Supplied)
", "A statement from the College of Obstetricians and Gynaecologists describes it as a complication occurring in approximately 1 in 300 cases of instrumental birth.", "For babies with low scores on the clinical indicator scale, it can be potentially life-threatening.", "But Billy's indicators were good.", "Billy was put into intensive care as a precaution.", "\"Nic sort of came over and said that they needed to take him somewhere else to have a look at him. And I think that's when fear crept in a little,\" Ms Tomkins\u00a0says.", "Billy recovered after three days and left intensive care.", "", "
Billy Eccles as a newborn.(Supplied)
", "Ms Tomkins developed post-natal depression and was later diagnosed with PTSD.", "After leaving hospital, the couple\u00a0organised an appointment in Dr Adham's office wanting to know what had happened.", "The couple say Dr Adham told them the haematoma could have been caused by the pushing and not from the kiwi cup.", "They also say he told them that the injuries with the forceps happened because the baby moved while the instruments were being applied.", "Dr Adham wrote to Ms Tomkins's GP after the meeting, saying the couple was traumatised because \"baby Billy had extensive facial bruising as a result of the attempted forceps delivery\".", "However, he made no reference to the subgaleal haematoma nor the intensive care stay.", "", "
Billy Eccles in ICU.(Supplied)
", "Ms Tomkins and Mr Eccles\u00a0were later told the case had gone to the hospital's quality assurance committee, but they do not know the outcome.", "\"Women shouldn't have to speak so loudly and advocate so hard for \u2026 their own choice in what happens to their body,\" Ms Tomkins says.", "
System of regulation 'wholly unsuitable', former investigator says
", "Former AHPRA investigator\u00a0David Gardner\u00a0says\u00a0the regulator would be carefully examining the complaints.", "\"A cluster like that, where it's more than one or two, certainly would raise the alarm bells at the end,\" he said.", "\"Often, in cases where you would have a series of serious complications, restrictions would be put in place as an interim measure while the regulator investigates.\"", "", "
Former AHPRA investigator David Gardner says the system needs reform.(ABC News: Lincoln Rothall)
", "There are no restrictions on Dr Adham's practice except for his own decision to have a senior clinician present during his laparoscopic surgery at the Canberra Hospital.", "The ABC\u00a0approached Dr Adham about the former patients in this story,\u00a0but he declined to comment.", "We also approached AHPRA, Canberra Health, Queanbeyan and Calvary John James hospitals.", "ACT Health Minister Rachel Stephen-Smith said a review of Dr Adham's cases showed his complication rates for \"laparoscopic surgery were consistent with other practitioners\".", "Canberra Health Services said, \"ensuring the quality and safety of our care is paramount\".\u00a0", "Queanbeyan Hospital said he had ceased working there but Dr Adham says that's \"just a suspension, subject to reinstatement following a positive review by the hospital\".", "Calvary John James said it had not received any complaints about the operations Dr Adham conducted there on Sam Cook-Bateman or Juanita Connors.", "AHPRA said it could not comment on matters regarding Dr Adham and his employer.", "A parliamentary inquiry has been examining AHPRA's handling of investigations and will hand down a report with its findings in March.", "Mr Gardner says the entire system needs to be reformed.", "\"The current system is so fragmented, and the regulator, the board is not permitted to look at a health service, it can only look at an individual,\" he said.", "\"So I think the system as it is now is wholly unsuitable.\"", "The first investigation into a complaint relating to Dr Adham that 7.30 has reported on was referred to AHPRA almost two years ago.", "None of the women the ABC has spoken to who complained have been interviewed. Many of them are taking their own legal action.", "\"If the public doesn't trust the regulator, if they don't have faith, that they'll deal with their complaints in an efficient and transparent way, then they just won't make the complaints,\" says lawyer Tom Ballantyne.", "\"And that's a real problem.\""]
